name: FindMyPhone
0:
”Alexa, Find My Phone.”
”Alexa, ask Find My Phone to add another number.”
”Alexa, ask Find My Phone to call Noah.”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: find my phone
Developer Terms of Use
des:
With Find My Phone, you can easily call your lost phone from Alexa, without syncing all of your contacts.

HOW IT WORKS

Pro Tip: Link your phone before you lose it.

1. To set up your phone, say “Alexa, Find My Phone” and you’ll be asked for your cell number.

2. To confirm it’s really you, we’ll send a 4-digit code via text message to your cell phone, that you can then provide to Alexa.

3. That’s it! You’re all set up. Now when you’ve lost your phone, simply say “Alexa, Find My Phone.”


IMPORTANT INFORMATION

There are a limited number of calls available, but you can get more with Find My Phone Unlimited.

To add additional numbers, just say “Alexa, ask Find My Phone to add a contact.”

Only US and cell numbers will work in the US. We don’t support landlines or other regions at this time.

We use five US-based outbound phone numbers. To ensure your phone will accept calls from these numbers, be sure to add them to your contacts: 
- 1.844.963.4389
- 1.844.736.6490
- 1.844.926.0163
- 1.855.938.4817
- 1.844.262.7102

Some cell providers will block the number we call you from. To prevent this, open your device's settings, select Phone, and select “Blocked Contacts.” Unblock the numbers listed above.

If you are not receiving the code via text message, text "un-stop" to all four of the numbers listed above.

We do not sell your cell number to third-party companies.

Please understand that we need your support to keep this service running.
Let us know if something is not working, by contacting: support@volleythat.com

LIST OF COMMANDS

- Alexa, Find My Phone.
- Alexa, ask Find My Phone to add a contact.
- Alexa, ask Find My Phone to call <contact name>.
- Alexa, ask Find My Phone to delete a contact.
- Alexa, ask Find My Phone to list contacts.
